benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Add custom fields to payment

covered: Valid Payload scenarios (TC01–TC07) resulting in HTTP 201 with created CustomField objects
Error handling for invalid payloads and missing/invalid headers (TC08 malformed JSON, TC09 missing header, TC12 invalid token)
Invalid or non-existent references (TC10 invalid paymentId format, TC11 non-existent payment) and corresponding error codes
Optional headers support (TC02) and header-driven behavior
Large payload handling (TC15) including 413 when payload too large
Field-level input validation and security checks (TC06 extra/unexpected fields, TC14 SQL/XSS payloads, TC16 missing required properties, TC21 unicode handling)
Concurrency and multi-client scenarios (TC19) and integrity checks with existing data (TC24, TC25)
Unsupported query parameters and API strictness (TC17)
Integration tests for persistence and cross-system visibility (TC24, TC25)
gaps: Rate limiting / throttling scenarios are not covered (e.g., multiple requests in a short time, bursty traffic)
Explicit 403 Forbidden coverage for insufficient permissions is not present (only 401/401-like cases addressed in TC12/TC09)
Server-side 500 Internal Server Error scenarios are not explicitly tested
Caching behavior (ETag/Cache-Control) is not tested for POST responses
Idempotency testing for repeated identical submissions beyond field-level duplicates (full duplicate-submit coverage) is limited
Fallback behavior or retries under transient failures is not explicitly covered
recommendations: Add a rate-limiting / throttling test (e.g., multiple concurrent requests in a short interval) to confirm resilience and proper error handling
Add a test that returns 403 Forbidden for insufficient permissions to cover authorization boundaries beyond 401
Introduce a test simulating a 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., DB outage) to verify server error handling and messaging
Add tests confirming caching headers behavior for POST (where applicable) or explicitly document non-caching behavior
Add explicit idempotency-focused tests (e.g., repeated identical POSTs to verify no unintended duplicates) and assert consistent outcomes
Enhance coverage around API strictness with explicit 400s for unexpected query parameters and varying strictness modes across environments
